entries.femaleVariant: Johnny...
That smell's the sea breeze.
Get up. Pacific's beautiful this time of day.
[Stand] Almost got flatlined.
Almost flatlined by that attack.
Almost.
Where are we?
The ocean is beautiful.
You're right, hard to take my eyes off it.
We in... Pacifica?
What's this building?
Old hotel – the Pistis Sophia. We're her sole guests right now.
[Step away] Why bring me here?
Why… why bring me here of all places?
[Step away] Saw Misty's meds in your hand.
Saw the pseudoendotrizine in your hand.
Think I'm not long for this world.
Can't very well function in this body without it, right?
You seriously considerin' Hanako's offer?
Got a better idea?
We share the same goals.
Don't start.
I'll do what I need to do to survive.
Don't start again.
I'll do what I need to survive. Even if I have to get my hands dirty.
Well?
Adam Smasher – fucker who got the better of me…
Whatever happens to me, I want him zero'd, gone, tossed into the wind as mulch.
Got a better idea?
Not yet, but I got a request.
Hanako and I want the same thing.
Heh, yeah…
Listen, you'll do what ya think's right. You're in charge here. Just got one request.
That your last wish – revenge?
Not about to risk my life for this.
Understood.
That your dyin' wish – revenge?
It's more than that. And I'll need you to take Rogue with you.
Not about to risk my skin to satisfy some revenge fantasy.
No risk involved. Rogue'll have your back.
Right. Understood.
And I want Rogue to be there with you.
It's important to me, and it's just as important for her.
Not sure Rogue's so sentimental.
Not how Rogue operates anymore.
So I tell Rogue everything?
Not sure Rogue's the sentimental type.
Hm, bitter bitch these days, said it yourself. And it has been a while…
So I'll jog her memory myself.
Not sure it's somethin' Rogue would bother with these days. She delegates.
Why stick her neck out for this, or at all?
'Cause I'll ask her to. Personally.
So I gotta tell Rogue... everything?
Think I'd better do that, handle it personally.
You'll drop the pills from Misty, and I'll steer the ship for a bit.
I'm not at all excited about this plan – realize that, right?
Just gonna have a quick chat with Rogue about Smasher, then I'm out. I promise.
Tell me what you're planning.
No deal.
Don't know if I trust you.
I can see what you're up to.
So, Hellman was right.
Need to know exactly what you plan to do.
I'll tell Rogue the truth, see if she's willin' to help.
All I gotta do is mention Smasher, serve him up on a platter, muse over the old days. Easy.
No. Askin' too much.
Sooner or later, you'll have to find your way to Mikoshi.
Rogue could be the ace you need.
Hellman said you'd do this – make a power grab or pitch for control.
Anders Hellman? And just what has he ever done to help you?
May not help, but he doesn't hurt me.
Not sure you've earned my trust.
This needs to work both ways, V.
You enjoy complete control over me at all times.
Don't even enjoy control over myself.
You're the one who makes the bad calls. All I can do is advise.
And ask for favors. Like I'm doin' now.
OK, I'll give you control.
Not gonna happen.
Need to think about it.
Might be you're right, might be a good idea.
End of discussion.
Need to think about it.
Fine. I'll do this... for you.
'Preciate it, thanks.
Take me to the Afterlife. Promise you won't regret this.
Rogue's convenient cover.
For what? Me seizing control of your body at long last?
Or some gonk-ass suicide plan to attack Arasaka again. Know you pretty damn well at this point, Johnny.
For the last time... No. Secret. Plan.
No, refuse to let you manipulate me again.
Huh. Not workin', is it?
'Fraid not. This discussion's over.
Fine, I get it. Should you change your mind, gimme a lift to the Afterlife.
Need to think it over.
Sure, thanks.
This is important to me, V. Just get me to the Afterlife and hop in the backseat for a bit, that's all.
Gimme a minute, you'll see.
You took over…
Yeah, lookin' that way...
Couldn't just leave you there, could I?
Nice to be behind the wheel again?
Honestly, never felt better – like, in my life.
Seriously consider taking the meds from Misty?
Thanks for helping.
Thanks for helpin'.
Return the favor first chance I get.
Got this strange impression your comatose self wanted to get rid of me. Actually put up a good fight.
Did you want to take the pill?
Caught you red-handed.
I gotcha – no talkin' your way outta this one. You wanted to pop the pill.
Did you wanna pop the pill?
Cool your chrome. If I'd wanted full control, I'd have taken it already, lots earlier.
Gonna pretend you didn't say that.
Oh fuck off, I know what you are.
Hey! I saved your ass, got you outta harm's way, and you're still gonna doubt my intentions?
Stopped you in the nick of time.
Think doubts crept in.
I believe you.
Think I woke up, derailed your plan in the nick of time.
Had doubts. Just when you were gonna drop 'em, your conscience poked you in the gut.
entries.maleVariant: Had doubts. Just when you were gonna drop them, your conscience poked you in the gut.

entries.femaleVariant: And I think fear of death's got you spewin' misdirected anger.
So Johnny Silverhand's got a conscience after all.
Christ, can we just drop it?
OK, I believe you.
Thanks.
Why you givin' them to me?
Wanted to show you somethin', c'mon.
Did you really want to take the meds from Misty?
What are imaginary friends for?
Think I'm gonna die soon.
They from the Mexican conflict?
I'll, uh, get you back someday.
Hold you to that.
Think I'm gonna die soon.
Thinking of sex, aren't you?
Your first thought was sex, wasn't it?
Well, technically, we'd be jackin' off. But, nah, you're not my type.
There's a hidey-hole where I'm standin'. Open it. Empty it.
[Open compartment]
These yours?
They were – belong to you now.
Huh, fifty years back... uh, Mexican conflict?
entries.maleVariant: Huh, fifty years back... Mexican conflict?

entries.femaleVariant: When I was a young pissbrain like you, I enlisted with a corp army.
Was in Mexico when I realized that no matter the conflict, corps always win. Ordinary people always lose.
So, that the truth you decided to reveal in song?
Well, deserted first. Wound up here, locked in this room. Laid in bed staring at the ceiling fan for a good month.
Egh, I wouldn't mind lyin' down right now, watchin' a fan until the end of time…
entries.maleVariant: Egh, I wouldn't mind lyin' down right now, watchin' a fan till the end of time…

entries.femaleVariant: Wastin' days, weeks – that's the step I want you to skip.
Why you givin' me these?
Yes.
Imagine we're deployed together, fightin' in a war side by side…
No.
Dunno.
I would, yeah.
No... I wouldn't.
I... I dunno.
Dumb question.
Dumbass question…
Tags belonged to a man who sacrificed his life for mine in Mexico.
Been thinkin' about our predicament…
Wanna be clear – I will do you no wrong. When the time comes, it'll be my life for yours, I'll agree to get wiped.
Tags are proof of my promise.
I'd do the same for you.
I... I'd do the same for you.
Kind gesture, I guess, but you can't really give me something I already have.
Body's always been mine.
Would you take a bullet for me?
Yes or no?
It's why I brought you here.
Body's mine, always has been. It is my decision, not an intruder's.
entries.maleVariant: Body's mine, always has been. It's my decision, not an intruder's.

entries.femaleVariant: Not true.
That ain't true.
Feelin' better. Should get goin'.
Still feel a sharp somethin' near your heart.
Doubt that's ever goin' away.
The Hotel Pistis Sophia – that right?
Just not today.
Mhm. Good place to die.
"Hey, Satan kicked me outta hell, thought I'd swing by."
"Hey, just busted out of soul prison. Check out my new ass."
Answer me.
[Enter through window]
Climb through the window. Can manage that, I think.
Let's not talk on it anymore for now, 'kay?
Yeah, thanks.
You wanted to know why I brought you here.
Suddenly remember Smasher, huh?
Seriously? Smasher? He suddenly comes to mind?
Last time we saw him, we--
Didn't have a chance to say hello. That's why we gotta find him. Finally end this.
Musta been nice… to have control of your faculties again?
Ugh, stop fakin' it.
War souvenir, I'm guessin'. War you checked out of.
Well, well, so you do pay attention sometimes.
After I deserted, I wound up here, locked in this room. Laid in bed staring at the ceiling fan for a good month.
Egh, wouldn't mind lyin' down right now, watchin' a fan turn till the end of time…
It's why I brought you here.
Wastin' days, weeks – that's the step I want you to skip.
